title: Inspection
description: Requirements for maintaining chemical inventory logs, Safety Data Sheets, proper chemical storage and labeling, and ensuring product and material quality

requirements.text: Are there chemical inventory logs for chemicals, including pesticides and fertilizers?
mandatoryStatements: Chemical inventory logs are maintained
Logs include all chemicals used on the operation (pesticides, fertilizers, sanitizers, etc.)
Logs track receipt, storage location, and use of chemicals
Inventory is updated regularly
Logs support traceability of chemical applications
Inventory helps ensure proper chemical rotation and prevents expired products from being used
requirements.verificationExpectations: Monthly verification of chemical inventory accuracy
requirements.monitoringExpectations: Update inventory immediately upon receipt or use of chemicals

requirements.text: Are copies of all Safety Data Sheets on file and fully accessible at all times with clear indexes?
mandatoryStatements: Safety Data Sheets (SDS) are on file for all chemicals
SDS are current and up to date
SDS are fully accessible to workers at all times
Clear index or table of contents facilitates quick access
SDS are available in language(s) understood by workers
New chemicals cannot be used until SDS is obtained and filed
SDS are reviewed with workers during chemical safety training
requirements.verificationExpectations: Quarterly audit of SDS file for completeness and accessibility
requirements.monitoringExpectations: Obtain and file SDS immediately when new chemicals are received

requirements.text: Are all chemicals (pesticides, fertilizers, sanitizers, detergents, lubricants, etc.) stored securely, safely and are they labeled correctly?
mandatoryStatements: Chemicals are stored in secure, locked areas with limited access
Storage area is designed to prevent spills and contain leaks
Incompatible chemicals are segregated
All chemicals are in original containers or properly labeled secondary containers
Labels include chemical name, hazard warnings, and use instructions
Storage conditions (temperature, ventilation) are appropriate
Storage area is organized and clean
Access to chemical storage is controlled and logged if appropriate
Chemical storage area is located away from food contact surfaces and water sources
requirements.verificationExpectations: Monthly inspection of chemical storage areas for security and labeling compliance
requirements.monitoringExpectations: Daily verification that storage areas are locked and secure, immediate correction of labeling deficiencies

requirements.text: Are the crop, ingredients (including water), food contact packaging and food contact surfaces within accepted tolerances for spoilage and without evidence of adulteration? ANY DOWN SCORE IN THIS QUESTION RESULTS IN AN AUTOMATIC FAILURE OF THE AUDIT.
mandatoryStatements: Crop is inspected and within quality specifications
No evidence of spoilage, decay, or quality defects
Water used in operation meets quality standards
Food contact packaging is clean, intact, and suitable for use
Food contact surfaces are clean, maintained, and in good repair
No evidence of physical, chemical, or biological contamination
No evidence of adulteration (contamination with filth, foreign material, etc.)
Regular inspection and monitoring of product and material quality
Rejected product and materials are identified and segregated
Product hold and release procedures are followed
requirements.verificationExpectations: Daily inspection of crop, materials, and surfaces during operations
requirements.monitoringExpectations: Continuous monitoring during harvest and handling, immediate action if spoilage or adulteration detected

capaInject: If chemical inventory logs not maintained: implement inventory system immediately, train responsible personnel within 7 days
If Safety Data Sheets missing or not accessible: obtain missing SDS within 24 hours, do not use chemicals without SDS, implement clear indexing system
If chemicals not stored securely or labeled correctly: immediate correction, re-label all chemicals, enhance security measures, retrain personnel
If spoilage or adulteration detected: immediate product hold, do not harvest or pack affected product, investigate extent of issue, dispose of or remediate as appropriate, audit fails
traceabilityInject: Chemical inventory logs must be traceable to specific chemicals, receipt dates, and usage
Safety Data Sheets must be traceable to specific chemicals and suppliers
Chemical storage inspections must be traceable to inspection dates and findings
Product quality inspections must be traceable to specific lots, dates, and inspectors
